Two perpendicular chords intersect in a circle. The segments of one chord are $3$ and $4$; 
the segments of the other are $6$ and $2$. Then the diameter of the circle is:  \\

$\textbf{(A)}\ \sqrt{89}\qquad 
\textbf{(B)}\ \sqrt{56}\qquad 
\textbf{(C)}\ \sqrt{61}\qquad 
\textbf{(D)}\ \sqrt{75}\qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ \sqrt{65} $
